tweets.text: Lets have our robots exchange mundane human cliches at the kids table while we talk about things they can’t understand yet

GPT-3 really makes you re evaluate the conversations you have with humans. When you realize a robot can reliably exchange pleasantries about the weather there is a human urge to stand on the shoulders of that rather then replicate it.
@katiecalmdown ruin them
I do like the part where they let the whole block rap the last few words of a bar, that's innovation
did they just hear chief keef i don't understand what's happening
can someone tell the NY rappers to rap on beat again
RT @transscribe: Liberals be like “why are you upset that we’re contemplating letting the fascists execute you in order to save democracy?”
Clinton won Harris County in 2016 https://t.co/Ttx8tdeZR6 https://t.co/DYWbUWlIHm

Harris County, Texas is #2 on my list with 212,685 voter records removed 2016-2018 based on EAVS data. Texas election code allows any registered voter to challenge the voter registration of another voter in the same county. Local Republicans have been doing this in bulk. https://t.co/EYAdxQJkcx
behold, 416 U.S. counties where the number of voters whose registration was removed is larger than the number of votes the 2016 presidential election was decided by https://t.co/0kREFrMLC3

My wrists have been hurting a lot lately and because I am now older than 25 I have been investing in ergonomics for my home workspace, but only just recently did I consider an ergonomic keyboard. If all goes well, on Monday this monstrosity arrives. Wish me luck. https://t.co/lRPRamUFzT
"You pulled down the wrong statue! We liked that guy!" well maybe if you were out with folks pulling down statues you could have mentioned it to them

one of my favorite small downstate new york towns painted a huge blue line down the middle of main st, but, they did a really bad job of painting it, so it's really a huge crooked blue line, and the poetry of that is apt

this was what I was looking for (for now, at least, maps next) https://t.co/O1J4wXPBa9
turn the .csv into an sqlite database and load it up in datasette and now we're really cooking with fire (except some towns are sneaking through my county filters) https://t.co/0vnCtSU94B
i will take another direction, for now, I am quite happy with the amount of work that can be done in one fell swoop, and a fun CSV to play with https://t.co/UeI9vBJVbG
@boundsocket All data roads lead to python, i resist
@boundsocket like i am an idiot but something like `sed -i '0,/^.*$/s//$(cat HEADERS.csv)/' FILE.csv`

@boundsocket I was having trouble with sed on OS X giving me funny errors which lead to strange StackOverflows which lead me to brew installing gnu sed and then quickly hating sed and wanting to move on – however, this is close to what I want. But what if my new headers are in a file?
now it wont turn into geojson, weak alchemy
